page.title: 02The Geography of our Block.
page.content: Thea area we surveyed is on the edge of the Cotswolds in Gloucestershire. The rock in our area falls into two groups; one of the groups consists of various sands,muds and silts. The other consists of different types of limestone. The area is placed in a deep wide valley that shadows Uley,with mostly deciduous trees growing thickly on the slopes of the hills. One of the well known hills is called Uley Bury. One of the other well known hills is called Cam Long Down,which looms up to the North West of Uley. East of the Severn and West of the Cotswolds lies Berkeley Vale which is very flat and there are less trees growing there than the Cotswolds.
